org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d

Class CursorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.io.cursor3d.CursorManager

  • public class CursorManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Create an instance of the CursorManager to obtain Cursor objects to be used by the application.

    To get a list of all the active Cursor objects, use the getActiveCursors() call. Additionally register a CursorActivationListener to know about Cursor objects activated or deactivated by the CursorManager during runtime.

    The CursorManager will add/remove Cursor objects based on the changes requested by the application. Once a Cursor is obtained all CursorEvents generated can be obtained using the Cursor.addCursorEventListener(CursorEventListener) call.

    The CursorManager is also responsible for setting properties of the Cursor objects - look at the various methods defined by this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CursorManager

        public CursorManager(org.gearvrf.GVRContext context)
        Create a CursorManager.

        Use the CursorManager(GVRContext, GVRScene) constructor to create a manager and also add any Cursor objects created to be automatically added to the set scene.

        If a GVRScene is not set then it is up to the application to add/remove the Cursor to/from the scene.

        Use the setScene(GVRScene) call to set the GVRScene explicitly.

        Parameters:
        context - The GVRf Context

      • CursorManager

        public CursorManager(org.gearvrf.GVRContext context,
                     org.gearvrf.GVRScene scene)
        Create a CursorManager.

        Any Cursor object created would be added to the provided GVRScene by default.

        Parameters:
        context - The GVRf Context
        scene - the default GVRScene to use while adding/removing Cursor objects.

      • CursorManager

        public CursorManager(org.gearvrf.GVRContext context,
                     org.gearvrf.GVRScene scene,
                     java.util.List<IoDevice> ioDevices)
        Create a CursorManager

        All IoDevices passed in the constructor will be associated with a Cursor if a match is found at initialization. Any IoDevice added after initialization with addIoDevice(IoDevice) will be only be assigned to a Cursor if that particular Cursor has not been attached to any IoDevice yet.

        Parameters:
        context - The GVRf Context
        scene - the default GVRScene to use while adding/removing Cursor objects.
        ioDevices - A list of IoDevices to add to the CursorManager at initialization.

    • Method Detail

      • getCursorThemes

        public java.util.List<CursorTheme> getCursorThemes()
        Gives a list of all the CursorThemes listed in the settings.xml file. Use this call to get a list of available CursorThemes and Cursor.setCursorTheme(CursorTheme) to change the CursorTheme associated with a Cursor
        Returns:
        A list of CursorThemes as defined in the settings.xml

      • resetCursorPosition

        public void resetCursorPosition()
        This method resets the position of the active cursor to the center of the camera view. This call does not work for Mouse or GearVr.

      • setCursorOnScreen

        public void setCursorOnScreen(boolean enable)
        Use this method to ensure that the cursor remains within the bounds of the users frustum
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable, false to disable.

      • addIoDevice

        public void addIoDevice(IoDevice ioDevice)
        Adds an IoDevice to the CursorManager.

        Each Cursor has a prioritized list of IoDevices it is compatible with in the settings.xml file. The added IoDevice will be attached to a cursor if:
        1. The Cursor is currently not attached to any other IoDevice.
        2. The IoDevice is in the list of the Cursor's compatible IoDevices as specified in the settings .xml file.
        3. There is no other IoDevice available that has a higher priority than the added IoDevice for that particular Cursor.

        Parameters:
        ioDevice - The IoDevice to be added.

      • getUsedIoDevices

        public java.util.List<IoDevice> getUsedIoDevices()
        This returns a list of IoDevices that are connected and currently controlling a Cursor. This list will not include any IoDevice that is not connected or connected but not controlling a Cursor.
        Returns:
        The list of used IoDevices

      • setScene

        public void setScene(org.gearvrf.GVRScene scene)
        Use this method to set a GVRScene. This call replaces the currently set GVRScene (if one was set either using the constructor or a previous setScene(GVRScene) call).

        If the provided GVRScene matches the currently set GVRScene then this call has no effect. Calling this method with a null resets the scene currently set with the CursorManager.
        Parameters:
        scene - the GVRScene to be set, or null.

      • enableSettingsCursor

        public void enableSettingsCursor(Cursor cursor)
        This method modifies the Cursor passed in the argument to a settings cursor. A settings cursor is a Cursor of type CursorType.LASER used to interact with a GVRViewSceneObject. Since it is easier to use a Cursor of type CursorType.LASER to interract with GVRViewSceneObject this convinience method is provided, so that the applications which do not use a Cursor of type CursorType.LASER do not have to instantiate and manage two cursors while interracting with a GVRViewSceneObject.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The Cursor whose IoDevice will be used for the settings cursor.

      • disableSettingsCursor

        public void disableSettingsCursor()
        This method disables the settings cursor enabled by the enableSettingsCursor(Cursor) method and restores the Cursor that was passed as an argument to the enableSettingsCursor(Cursor) method. This method is used once interraction with a GVRViewSceneObject is not longer needed.

      • setSettingsMenuVisibility

        public void setSettingsMenuVisibility(Cursor cursor,
                                      boolean visible)
        Use this method to show/hide the settings menu.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The Cursor object that triggered this action
        visible - use true to show the settings menu, false to hide it.

      • getActiveCursors

        public java.util.List<Cursor> getActiveCursors()
        Request the manager for the list of currently active Cursors.

        Make sure the CursorActivationListener is set after making this call to get updates about Cursor objects activated or deactivated from the CursorManager.

      • getInactiveCursors

        public java.util.List<Cursor> getInactiveCursors()
        Request the CursorManager for a list of Cursors that are not currently active.

        These Cursors are declared in the settings.xml but do not have an IoDevice attached to them.
        Returns:
        the list of inactive Cursors

      • addCursorActivationListener

        public void addCursorActivationListener(CursorActivationListener listener)
        Register a CursorActivationListener with the manager.

        The listener notifies the application whenever a Cursor is added/removed from the manager. Note that this call CursorActivationListener.onActivated(Cursor) would only return the future Cursor objects activated. To know the list of Cursor objects activated at the time of this call, make use of the getActiveCursors().

        Parameters:
        listener - the CursorActivationListener to be added.null objects are ignored.

      • removeCursorActivationListener

        public void removeCursorActivationListener(CursorActivationListener listener)
        Remove a registered CursorActivationListener
        Parameters:
        listener - the CursorActivationListener to be removed.null objects are ignored.

      • makeSceneSelectable

        public void makeSceneSelectable(org.gearvrf.GVRScene scene)
        Use this call to make all the GVRSceneObjects in the provided GVRScene to be selectable.

        In order to have more control over objects that can be made selectable make use of the addSelectableObject(GVRSceneObject) method.

        Note that this call will set the current scene as the provided scene. If the provided scene is same the currently set scene then this method will have no effect. Passing null will remove any objects that are selectable and set the scene to null

        Parameters:
        scene - the GVRScene to be made selectable or null.

      • removeAllSelectableObjects

        public void removeAllSelectableObjects()
        Remove all the GVRSceneObjects that have been made selectable.

      • addSelectableObject

        public boolean addSelectableObject(org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject object)
        This call makes sure that the GVRSceneObject passed is a Cursor selectable object. The Cursor would deliver events using the CursorEventListener every time an interaction happens with the GVRSceneObject.

        The Cursor would also provide a visual cue when over an object that this selectable to notify that the user can interact with the object.

        Passing an object makes it and its descendant tree selectable. If the entire scene has been made selectable and the GVRSceneObject is a part of the Scene, then this call will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        object - the GVRSceneObject that is to be made selectable.
        Returns:
        true on success or false if the object does not have a GVRMesh or in case the object was already set as selectable.

      • removeSelectableObject

        public boolean removeSelectableObject(org.gearvrf.GVRSceneObject object)
        This call is for objects for which addSelectableObject(GVRSceneObject) was called. After calling this on a GVRSceneObject there will be no CursorEvents generated when a Cursor interacts with this GVRSceneObject. The GVRSceneObject that was passed in addSelectableObject(GVRSceneObject) should be passed in here.
        Parameters:
        object - The GVRSceneObject that is to be made un-selectable.
        Returns:
        true on success or false if GVRSceneObject was not set as selectable using the addSelectableObject(GVRSceneObject)

      • setSoundEnabled

        public void setSoundEnabled(boolean enable)
        By default the all sounds defined by the Cursor are played during interaction. Use this call to disable all sounds played.

        true to enable all sounds, false to disable.

        Parameters:
        enable - use false to disable all sounds and true to re-enable.

      • isSoundEnabled

        public boolean isSoundEnabled()
        Gets the status of the Sounds for the CursorManager
        Returns:
        true if sound is enabled, false if it is disabled

      • close

        public void close()
        Called to perform post clean up of the CursorManager. All devices registered with the Cursor objects are cleared and the all device listeners are unregistered. Usually called on destroy.

      • isDepthOrderEnabled

        public boolean isDepthOrderEnabled()

      • setDepthOrderEnabled

        public void setDepthOrderEnabled(boolean depthOrderEnabled)
        CursorEvents can be grouped with other CursorEvents according to the depth of the GVRSceneObject that the event occurred on. This feature can be enabled or disabled using setDepthOrderEnabled(boolean). For eg. When a Cursor changes position or state and if that change generated CursorEvents on multiple GVRSceneObjects, the generated CursorEvents can be sent in order of the distance of the GVRSceneObject from origin, where the CursorEvent associated with the GVRSceneObject closest to the origin is delivered first and has an SensorEvent.EventGroup.MULTI_START as the SensorEvent.EventGroup. All subsequent CursorEvents in the same group have SensorEvent.EventGroup.MULTI and are delivered in depth order as described above. The last CursorEvent in that group has SensorEvent.EventGroup.MULTI_STOP as the SensorEvent.EventGroup value. CursorEvents that occurred on only a single GVRSceneObject have SensorEvent.EventGroup.SINGLE set as their SensorEvent.EventGroup. However when depth order is disabled all CursorEvents have the SensorEvent.EventGroup.GROUP_DISABLED as their SensorEvent.EventGroup value. Enabling this feature will incur extra cost every time there is a change in the Cursor position or state. The CursorEvents need to be grouped and sorted according to the distance of the associated GVRSceneObjects from the origin. This feature should only be turned on if needed. The SensorEvent.EventGroup given to CursorEvents can be used in apps where there are multiple overlapping GVRSceneObjects and the application has to decide which of the GVRSceneObjects will handle the CursorEvent.
        Parameters:
        depthOrderEnabled -
        See Also:
        CursorEvent.getEventGroup()

      • saveSettings

        public void saveSettings()
        Save the configuration of the CursorManager that is currently in use.

        The configuration includes the following things:
        1. The themes being used by each Cursor
        2. The state of the Cursors i.e. enabled/disabled
        3. The IoDevice being used by each active Cursor. The configuration will be persisted across app launches.

      • getGVRContext

        public org.gearvrf.GVRContext getGVRContext()
        Gets the GVRContext instance associated with the CursorManager. This is the GVRContext object passed in the constructor.
        Returns:
        the GVRContext instance.
